title: New Sonoma State president outlines his vision for university turnaround but major changes still up in the air
description: A year after the announcement of $24 million in budget cuts, sweeping layoffs and program closures left the SSU campus reeling, new leadership with $90 million in rescue funds outlines what's next and what's undecided.

Sonoma State President [Michael Spagna](https://www.pressdemocrat.com/2025/11/19/sonoma-state-president-michael-spagna/) struck an enthusiastic if noncommittal tone in his first press conference 10 days into his tenure leading a university seeking its way back from the fiscal brink.

“I am grateful and privileged to be part of how the university reimagines its way forward from what has been a very challenging year,” Spagna said at the briefing Friday, Jan. 30 — a year and a week after his predecessor unveiled an unprecedented and unpopular wave of budget cuts that convulsed the university and its wider community.
